Perfect Strangers is the eleventh studio album by Deep Purple, released in November 1984. It represents the first album recorded by the reformed, and most successful and popular, &#039;Mark II&#039; line-up. It was the first Deep Purple album in eight years, and the first with the Mk II lineup for eleven years, the last being Who Do We Think We Are in 1973.

On this cassette track I increase the record/playback level +15 dB for boost.
I also reduced the background noise level during PLAYBACK using Dolby B NR.
The reason I used Dolby B instead of Dolby C or S was they caused too much 
reduction at high frequencies which I do not like. 
Listen and enjoy... "Perfect Strangers" HUYE

Tracks are encoded losslessly in FLAC format (16 bit, stereo, 44.1 kHz).
